issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Release
components.description: This component is used for issues related to releasing the product. Release notes, copying builds to the server, etc.

fields.description:
When using the debugger (Windows  - Android in this instance) the application crashes after a certain period of time. 

*Test Steps*
# Create and Alloy application 
# Set some debug points in the {{index.js}}
# Set studio to {{debug}}
# Debug the app
# Once the debugging view is shown use the Step into/over/return buttons 
# After a period of time the following error is shown in studio (see screenshot) and the application crashes


*Actual result*
Studio shows the error shown in the screenshot and the emulator/device crash. 

*Expected result*
Debugging should work without any issues.
fields.environment:
SDK Version: 7.4.1.v20180928073117
APPC Studio Version: 5.1.1.201809051655
Nexus 6P 8.1
Name = Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise
Version = 10.0.15063
Architecture = 64bit
CPU Cores = 8
Memory = 15.9GB
Node.js = 8.9.1
Appcelerator CLI = 7.0.6

comments.body: I checked it with 7.4.0.GA & debugging works fine.
